problems.title: Rearranging the Kinematic Equation
problems.text: Given v = u + at, a student needs to find the time t.

checkpoints.question: Rearranging v = u + at for t gives?
checkpoints.hint_on_first_wrong: Subtract u from both sides: v - u = at. Then divide by a.

error_patterns.diagnosis: You added u instead of subtracting. First step is v - u = at.
You inverted the division. From at = v - u, divide both sides by a, not the other way around.

problems.title: Solving for Velocity from KE
problems.text: Kinetic energy KE = ½mv². If KE = 200 J and m = 4 kg, find v.

checkpoints.question: Rearrange ½mv² = KE for v²:
checkpoints.hint_on_first_wrong: Multiply both sides by 2: mv² = 2KE. Then divide by m: v² = 2KE/m.

error_patterns.diagnosis: The ½ was in front of mv². Multiply both sides by 2 first to get mv² = 2KE.
You forgot to take the square root. v = √(v²), not just v².
